articles.title: An outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease cost the UK billions in 2001, so how can Australia keep it out? - ABC News
articles.description: If foot-and-mouth disease reaches Australia, it will send a wrecking ball through the economy, as it did in the UK 20 years ago. So what is the plan to keep it out? And how would an outbreak be contained?
articles.content:
In the winter of 2001, acrid plumes of smoke rose from the British countryside as millions of cows, sheep and pigs were incinerated in a desperate war against foot-and-mouth disease.

articles.title: Australian IVF clinics can't keep up with the demand for donor sperm. Here's why - 9News
articles.description: A sperm donor shortage exacerbated by the pandemic is continuing to hit the IVF industry with one major Victorian clinic reporting demand is outstripping supply by a factor of three to one.
